comments.body: Nit: For most of these, I am fine with these simple CHECK existence tests, but there are non-trivial calculations that happen in these quantized conversions. I'd feel better with some additional checks on the actual attribute values. Here and elsewhere. I am fine with this as a TODO (I know these were all generated by a tool that did correctness tests, and we may want to extend the tool vs hand editing).
Will add a TODO covering all of the "fakequant" tests.  These all need some other TLC because the random double precision numbers are hard to look at (and create awfully long lines).
Again: non-trivial. Would prefer a bit more specificity in the value flows for key parts. A TODO is fine.

This test and the corresponding one in TF were too complicated to begin with.  Our original unit test for this operator contains some additional reduce and concat operators to get the result back down to a single tensor.  The next patch will have those operators manually stripped out and both Split tests will look much cleaner.
